page.title: omniORB
page.head: Free High Performance ORB

ul.li: 29 August 2002 - The omniORB mailing list is broken at the moment. It will be back as soon as possible.
22 August 2002 - omniORB 4.0.0 beta 2 and omniORBpy 2.0 beta 2 released. Download them from here.
2 August 2002 - Commercial support for omniORB is available.
12 June 2002 - omniORB 3.0.5 and omniORBpy 1.5 released. Download them from here.
24 April 2002 - AT&T Laboratories Cambridge closed. omniORB is now independent.

page.p: omniORB is a robust high performance CORBA ORB for C++ and Python. It is freely available under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License (for the libraries), and GNU General Public License (for the tools). It is one of only three ORBs to be awarded the Open Group's Open Brand for CORBA. This means that omniORB has been tested and certified CORBA 2.1 compliant. You can find out more about the branding program at the Open Group.

You might want to read more about the history of omniORB, or see a summary of omniORB's features. On the Wiki page, you can see a list of people and organisations using omniORB, and add yourself to the list.
To get help with using omniORB, or to keep up with the latest developments, subscribe to the omniORB mailing list.
